_exec_summary.SummaryText:
AT PRAIRIE AG TAKE PRIDE IN OUR FACILITIES,  AND DO AS MUCH AS WE CAN TO ENSURE THAT  OUR FACILITIES ARE SANITARY AND SAFE.  ALL OF OUR AMMONIA FACILITIES ARE INSPECTED TWICE A YEAR BY STATE INSPECTORS AS WELL AS THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENTS.  THEY ARE KEPT UP TO DATE WITH ALL THE LATEST SAFETY EQUIPMENT REQUIRED BY CODES , STANDARDS AND LAWS.  ALL OF OUR EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED BY PRAIRIE AG TO COMPLETE A SAFETY TRAINING COURSE PUT ON BY IOWA AGRI BUSINESS ASSOCIATION OF IOWA SPECIFICALLY FOR ANHYDROUS AMMONIA AS WELL AS OTHER AREAS OF THE BUSINESS. .                                                              1, FACILITY INFORMATION:  THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THIS LOCATION IS THE STORAGE AND SALE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA AND DRY FERTILIZER  THE MAXIMUM AMOUNT OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA STORED AT THIS FACILITY IS IN STORAGE TANKS ONLYIS APPROXIMATLY 240,000 POUNDS. .                                                                                                  


 2. FACILITY POLOCY:  THE MANAGEMENT, EMPLOYEES AND OWNERS ARE COMMITED TO THE PREVENTION OF ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA .  THIS FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENTS AND LAW ENFORCEMENT PERSONELL TO MITIGATE ANY RELEASE TO THE ENVIRONMENT OF OUR COMMUNITY.  THIS RMP FACILITY IS OPPERATED ON AN AS NEEDED BASIS WITH A  STAFF PRESENT DURING THE RECIEVING AND RELOADING OF PRODUCT FOR DELIVERY.  DURING PERIODS OF NON OPERATION THIS FACILITY IS IS PATROLED BY LOCAL LAW INFORCEMENT AT VARIOUS TIMES OF THE NIGHT AND DAY, WHERE ANYTHING OUT OF THE ORDINARY IS REPORTED TO OUR 24 HOUR TELEPHONE NUMBERS POSTED IN MANY AREAS OF OUR FACILITY AND APPROPIATE ACTION IS TAKEN .

3.  WORST CASE SCENARIO:  TOTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA FROM A STORAGE TANK   THE DISTANCE TO THE END POINT WOULD BE APROXIMATELY 3 MILES. .                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       4.  ALTERNATIVE CASE SCENARIO:  A RELEASE FROM A BREAK IN A TRANSFER HOSE.  THE DISTANCE TO END POINT WOULD BE APPROXIMATELY .4 MILES .                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            5.  FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:  THERE HASE BEEN NO ACCIDENTAL RELEASEES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS THAT HAS CAUSED PROPERTY DAMAGE TO THE FACILITY, INJURIES OR DEATH ON OR OFF SITE, EVACUATIONS OR ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGES .                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        6.  EMERGENCY R

ESPONSE PLAN:  OUR FACILITY COORDINATES WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENTS AND RESPONDERS. WE DO NOT PLAN TO HAVE OUR EMPLOYEES RESPOND TO A MAJOR RELEASE. .                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        7.  ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM:  STORAGE TANKS AND NURSE TANKS ARE INSPECTED DAILEY TO ENSURE THAT VAVES ARE LOCKED AND HAVE NOT BEEN TAMPERED WITH, AND THAT ALL VALVES ARE TIGHTLY SHUT AND NOT LEAKING.  PERIODIC EVALUATIONS ARE ALSO PERFORMED TO ASSES THE MAINTENANCE OF EQUIPMENT AND SAFE CONDITIONS AT THE FACILITY. .                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        8.   PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:  SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ONGOING PROCESS AT THIS FACILITY. AFTER PERIODIC EVALUATIONS  HAVE BEEN PERFORMED, WHATEVER NEEDS TO BE IMPLEMENTED TO IMPROVE THE SAFETY OF THIS FACILITY IS IMMEDIATLEY PUT INTO EFFECT. .
FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION CONTACT:  DARREN CADY (PRAIRIE AG COOP) 319 -865-1450
